page.title: 17POPULATION
page.content: About 1250 servicemen with their families and single men and women live at the USAF Base. They reflect a true cross-section of American society. Recruitment is nationwide, but N.E. America provides many with the right technical background. Barriers may exist due to rank, but not to social class.The remaining 50 or so other residents live mostly in scattered houses and,among them, some Americans. The forestry and farm workers are mostly locally born and bred but one or two families live in this relative isolation from choice. There are no statistics to show that intermittent aircraft noise has a deleterious effect on health. With the regular posting-in and out of servicemen an average age of below 30 is maintained, happily avoiding problems of death and old-age, at least at the base.
